Lastly, we show that CLMR generalises to out-of-domain datasets by pre-training it on entirely different music datasets. Pre-training is performed on the Million Song Dataset, FMA, Billboard and GTZAN separately and linear evaluation is performed on the MagnaTagATune dataset. https://t.co/pIVsiKxSOt

When fine-tuning the linear classifier (only!) using the self-supervised learned representations on 1% of the labels (= 259 songs for MagnaTagATune), it still achieves 33.1% AP. CLMR shows a similar result for the Million Song Dataset until ~24.000 songs (10% of the labels). https://t.co/JXO3Niz0Qp

A linear classifier trained on our self-supervised representations matches fully supervised SampleCNN on the MagnaTagATune dataset (our average precision is 35.4% vs. 34.4% for supervised training). On the Million Song Dataset, our results are competitive to supervised models. https://t.co/QgkVHCoQdG

そして、優れた曲であるということは、多くの支持を集め、50年後にも残っているような名曲となり、Million Song Datasetに収録されるような曲になる可能性も高くなります。

つまり、Million Song Datasetに収録されている古い楽曲は「音色が多様でピッチも幅広い」という、
Million Song Datasetの収録楽曲のうち、1955年から1959年にかけてリリースされたものは2650曲であるのに対し、2005年から2009年にかけてリリースされたものはなんと17万7808曲で、同じ5年間でも明らかに収録数が異なることがわかります。
音色・ピッチ・音量という3つの要素で、ポピュラー音楽は良好な変化がみられていないように感じられますが、研究で使用されたデータセットのMillion Song Datasetは、収録楽曲に偏りがあるため、選択バイアスがかかっているのではと科学雑誌のScientific Americanが指摘しています。

@BrianRoemmele @hashtagagitated I was asking about the ones that HashtagAgitated listed, I understand the premise here -- but I would be interested in a meta-analysis of the Million Song Dataset wrt volume of plays and number of listeners in total. The long tail is longer and the audience much bigger now.

@Deve_Dy @BrianRoemmele the thing on my mind is not about the analysis, but the starting set. I can't find anything about how the one million song dataset was created, but there's no indication that it is based on relative popularity.
At least, I can't see anything about how the songs in that million song dataset are chosen. I think you have to read it as "popular music" not music that is popular.

@its_adamneely @BrianRoemmele The paper doesn't define individual tone complexity, so its probably referring to the homogenization of timbral pallette.
However a million song dataset can't possibly capture the music landscape of the past few decades
